page.title: 06HOME LIFE SURVEY
page.content: We used a questionaire on "home life" in every class in St John's school. We then took the results from the three top junior classes and the top infant class, this gave us 100 children. From this we produced the following piece on home life. We found that most children slept in a bed only a few had a bunk bed. Nightware was fairly evenly divided, pyjamas for boys and nightdresses for girls.50% of the children had their own room and used a shower. Nearly every child had an uncooked breakfast of toast and conrnflakes. 47% However had a hot evening meal cooked on a gas stove. Many homes had a deep freeze. Houses are mostly heated by central heating supplemented by gas fires, 24% had fire guards.50% of the children have a video or computer.75% of the children have pets.47% holiday abroad.
